item.title: Brief Encounter: As time goes by, fate writes a melancholic romance
item.description: David Lean is a name that invokes images of breathtaking desert sunrises, dense jungle foliage, and empty Arctic snowscapes; yet his most critically acclaimed work is an intimate one, entirely set in a train station.

item.title: Review: “17776” is the best argument against capitalist immortality humanity has to offer
Heartstopper is redefining queer media
item.description: Confronting the unaccepting abusive parents and homophobic bullies and discriminatory governments of the world is a necessary and important task, but one I'm not necessarily up for when I boot up Netflix or go to a theater.
